page.title: 18SENIOR CITIZENS-HAMSTERLEY
page.content: A sample survey of Senior Citizens showed a group of people generally satisfied with their way of life, mainly independent following many and varied pursuits.Ages ranged from early 60 years to late 80 years,many still living with their partners and nearly all in regular contact with friends and relations. Those in need of help at home are provided for by Social Services.Visits to a doctor appear to be about average for the age group. Most did their own shopping at supermarkets at nearby towns,but meat is mainly got from the village butcher Interests are mainly followed in and around the home through reading,crafts and television,also activities at the village hall and church.They enjoy living here for the peace and quiet, beauty and friendliness for which they accept any disadvantages of rural life
